block.p: The defending champion Kelli Kuehne shot a five-under-par 67 yesterday to race past the struggling Mi Hyun Kim and take the third-round lead in the L.P.G.A. Corning Classic in Corning, N.Y.
Kuehne overcame a double-bogey on the first hole and finished the round at 11-under 205, one shot ahead of Betsy King, who had a 69.
The defending champion Kelli Kuehne shot a five-under-par 67 yesterday to race past the struggling Mi Hyun Kim and take the third-round lead in the L.P.G.A. Corning Classic in Corning, N.Y.
Kuehne overcame a double-bogey on the first hole and finished the round at 11-under 205, one shot ahead of Betsy King, who had a 69.
Alone in third place another stroke back was Nancy Ramsbottom after a somewhat erratic 70.
Kim, who began the day with a two-shot lead over King, Ramsbottom and Cindy Flom, self-destructed with a 76, as did Flom.
NELSON GRABS LEAD: Larry Nelson shot a six-under-par 66 yesterday to take a one-stroke lead over Tom Watson after the second round of the Senior PGA Tour's Boone Valley Classic.

After two inches of rain hit the water-logged course last night, tour officials said they will make a decision today on whether to cancel the final round. If the round is played, the course will be closed to spectators, sponsors and volunteers.
Nelson had seven birdies and a bogey for a 12-under 132 total.
